snippet: The unemployment rate fell to its lowest level since June 2008, but average hourly earnings fell 0.2 percent, erasing some of the gains of last month.
abstract: Labor Dept reports total employment numbers were up in December 2014 and unemployment rate improved to 5.6 percent; while numbers offer positive outlook for United States economy in 2015, decline in average hourly earnings suggests that economic recovery is still incomplete; combination of low unemployment and low wages complicates matters for Federal Reserve, which is expected to raise interest rates in 2015 for first time in years.
lead_paragraph: The unemployment rate fell to its lowest level since June 2008, but average hourly earnings fell 0.2 percent, erasing some of the gains of last month.

headline.main: Job Growth Fails to Help Paychecks of Workers
headline.print_headline: Job Growth Fails to Help Paychecks of Workers
